Description: Egyptian terracotta figurine of Isis-Hathor. Fragment of bare feet only. Mould-made and hollow. White coating and paint traces. Red-brown Nile silt with mica and white sandy inclusions.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: South Mound, South Mound 49214 N.I.492.40
Curator's comments: Found in a late second century BC context. Leg and feet fragment of a Isis-Aphrodite anasyr(o)mene’ / Isis-Bubastis or more likely Isis-Hathor figure. Parallels dated to the Ptolemaic or Roman period across Egypt, with close parallels from Naukratis (Bailey 2008, no.2997, GR 1888,0601.110; Ashmolean Museum, Oxford, no. 1888.178; Cambridge, Museum of Classical Archaeology NA636).
Bibliographic references: Leonard 1997 / Ancient Naukratis: Excavations at a Greek Emporion in Egypt, Part I: The excavations at Kom Ge’if. (p. 288. no.3, pl. 7.3)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DD.144) (Phase 3)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: pl. 7.2 ; p. 288. no.3 (catalogue number)
